fields.description:
As a user of the Eucalyptus Management Console I would like to view CloudWatch metrics for my Auto Scaling groups as charts/graphs so that I can determine how those components of my application are performing.

Auto Scaling groups offer the following metrics:
- GroupTotalInstances	
- GroupInServiceInstances
- GroupMinSize
- GroupMaxSize
- GroupDesiredCapacity
- GroupPendingInstances	
- GroupTerminatingInstances	
- GroupStandbyInstances

Note: The GroupStandybyInstances metric is currently not supported in Eucalyptus

Displaying EC2-related metrics for instances in the scaling group is tracked in GUI-2368
fields.summary: CloudWatch charts for auto scaling groups: scaling group metrics

comments.body: OK to implement without blocker ticket resolved.

hi [~kgill], please note that we will also need to display charts/metrics for instances within the ASGs, most likely. All EC2 metrics for instances are available for the instances in scaling groups, and users may want to track those for the ASG's instances and set alarms for those (not sure yet if individually or across all instances in the group) that perform instance actions based on alarm state like stop or terminate, as well as ASG scaling actions. Just to help iterative design and implementation, you might want to limit the scope of this ticket to just the ASG metrics and charts, and create a separate ticket for the instance metrics and charts for the instances in the scaling group. For tracking purposes, etc. reference: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/DeveloperGuide/as-instance-monitoring.html

CC: [~lnajjar], you will likely need an additional UX ticket blocking [~kgill]'s second implementation ticket for wireframing instance charts for instances in a scaling group, and probably more tickets for creating alarms and appropriate actions for the ASG's instances.

[~jloza]: We already have instance charts on the Instance Monitoring page, so I assumed this ticket would be scoped to a scaling group rather than individual instances.

For creating alarms on instances in a scaling group, we ([~lnajjar], [~ashamblin] and I) discussed that a bit during our Alarms meeting yesterday and we questioned the value of setting alarms on individual instances in a scaling group if those instances are somewhat ephemeral.

For displaying EC2 metrics for instances in a scaling group, the wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Scaling+group+details includes the CPUUtilization of the instances in the ASG.  Are there other EC2 metric charts we should consider pulling in there?

[~kgill], yeah, we probably should, but we don't have to do that in the scope of this ticket. 

I was chatting with [~hspencer] earlier, and there are use cases for setting alarms and actions for instances in scaling groups, most likely. Like if the CPU for an instance jumps high, the use case may be to A) stop or terminate that instance and then B) the ASG settings for desired size will launch a new instance in its place. We can work all that out later, though, I just wanted to have a record that this ticket should be scoped only to the ASG metrics and charts and we may need additional iterative work to get to fully complete.
Note that running the autoscaling sequence locally fails during the ASGDetailPage.change_capacity_on_detail_page() step... https://gist.github.com/kamalgill/e484a004e2ad7baf1ee4

Branch GUI-2332 ready for UX review.  [~lnajjar]: Could you update the scaling group details page wireframe Monitoring tab to separate out the Group min/desired/max size charts as the CloudWatch API calls are scoped to a single metric?

Wireframe change done.

It appears that the Scaling group metrics "Standby instances" graph listed in the Description for this ticket is not in the coded version:

 !No Standby Instances.png|thumbnail! 

Is that because there are no standby instances?

Also, from the comments it is not clear what you did with the "Instance metrics" for the auto scaling group details Monitoring tab. Did you end up moving those to a different ticket?

[~lnajjar]: We'll need to remove the Standby Instances chart from the wireframe since Eucalyptus doesn't support that.  Also note that the Instance metrics work is tracked in GUI-2368.  Both of these were noted in the ticket description here.
Reassigned to [~jloza] for UX review since I did the wireframing for this.
Fab work, [~kgill]! I assume the header text will be put in place when the instance metrics ticket is done, so UX review passed on this one, ready for code review!
